bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
In the latest update to dump, dump-0.4-0.28.b45.fc24.x86_64.rpm, passing the -Q flag (dump QFA positions to tape) fails with the following relevant lines of output:
DUMP: writing QFA positions to (null) DUMP: can't open tapeposfile DUMP: The ENTIRE dump is aborted.
This seems to be a known issue in dump version 0.4b45, see
https://sourceforge.net/p/dump/bugs/165/?limit=25
I have temporarily reverted to the previous baseline dump package as workaround for now.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
dump-0.4-0.28.b45.fc24
How reproducible:
Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run dump with -Q <filename> argument
Actual results:
dump fails when passed -Q flag, see output sample below:
DUMP: writing QFA positions to (null) DUMP: can't open tapeposfile DUMP: The ENTIRE dump is aborted.
Expected results:
Additional info:
dump-0.4-0.29.b45.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-83a3339530
dump-0.4-0.29.b45.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a344486d48

dump-0.4-0.29.b45.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a344486d48
Grabbed test build from koji, seems to have fixed the issue, -Q flag is no longer being ignored. Thanks for the quick response.

dump-0.4-0.29.b45.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-83a3339530
dump-0.4-0.29.b45.fc24 fixes the issue for me.
dump-0.4-0.29.b45.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
dump-0.4-0.30.b46.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-efe4ccf884

dump-0.4-0.30.b46.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-efe4ccf884
dump-0.4-0.30.b46.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
